Key Arguments: The legislation will stifle free speech.
The public is capable of making informed decisions without government intervention.
The bill undermines the intelligence of the general public, contributing to a 'Nanny State'.
The government has been wrong in the past, particularly regarding COVID-19 vaccine information.
Decisions on misinformation will be biased towards government views, threatening free speech.
Notable Quotes: This Bill is seemingly trying to belittle the intelligence of the general public to make decisions for themselves – a further progression into the 'Nanny State'.
I am Strongly Opposed to the removal of Free Speech by this Bill.
The big problem is who decides – only those who agree with the government will decide as they will be Government employees and their job may well depend on their views.
